page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO PENSARN cont
page.content: The sea is a murky brown, and the sewers deposit their silt on the beach, creating an unpleasant smell. Debris is washed up on the shore daily to add to the pollution; however tourists still venture down to the beach, oblivious to sight and smells. Some have doubts about the area, but still come for their annual jaunts to the 'beautiful' beaches of North Wales. The weather will influence your decision on Pensarn and the beach; on a sunny day it is a pleasant area but on a dull day it is bleak.
